item.title: Why Highguard Failed & Highguard Layoffs, Explained
item.content:encoded:
Highguard didn‚Äôt arrive with much hype, its build-up was even less prominent, and the final result can only be considered a disaster that resulted in substantial layoffs for Highguard developer Wildlight Entertainment.

The final game announcement for The Game Awards 2025 was Highguard. Whereas millions of players were hoping for a new God of War, Bloodborne, or something earth-shatteringly big, Geoff Keighley couldn‚Äôt contain his excitement as Highguard was finally revealed.

Highguard‚Äôs Steam player base plummeted by over 95% in just over two weeks. The downward decline has had detriental effects, but it was hard to see anything else happening.

Why Wasn‚Äôt Highguard A Success?

Highguard was a decent game at launch with next-to-no redeeming qualities or innovative features. In a saturated market of live-service shooters and free-to-play games, Highguard didn‚Äôt have anywhere near enough content at launch to suggest it could last, and the frosty reception to Highguard‚Äôs TGA 2025 reveal ultimately caused the title‚Äôs instant downfall.

The Game Awards 2025

Geoff Keighley has a reputation for hyping things up that don‚Äôt always deliver, and there‚Äôs nothing wrong with that. One person‚Äôs view won‚Äôt resonate with everyone, maybe not at all. But giving Highguard the sign-off slot for TGA 2025 meant the game had to dazzle and deliver.

Expectations for The Game Awards, Summer Game Fest, and other mega showcases are usually unrealistically high. Players want EVERYTHING and usually don‚Äôt get anything they want. When a baying audience is clinging on for a Half-Life 3 or an announcement to end all, Highguard was not seen as it. Social media (for the most part) wasn‚Äôt giving Highguard much of a chance, getting the game off to a bad start.

From December 11 (TGA 2025) until a few days before launch, Highguard‚Äôs socials were like a ghost town. YouTube, X, you name it; no gameplay footage, no new trailers, and nothing from Wildlight. Some viewed this as a deliberate marketing strategy designed to build intrigue and curiosity close to its debut.

There‚Äôs a thought that had Highguard been highly anticipated, the gaming community would have accepted it. Instead, it cast more negative light on Highguard, even bringing doubt about its future. Finally, on January 23, a gameplay showcase was announced‚Äîtaking place minutes before the servers went online. It was a bold strategy.

Further clarification arrived when it was revealed that Highguard was meant to be a ‚ÄòShadowdrop‚Äô, but Geoff Keighley wanted it at The Game Awards. In hindsight, a shadowdrop possibly could‚Äôve helped the game‚Äôs fortunes by not giving people time to make up their mind in advance.

Highguard‚Äôs Release & Reception

It was go time, and anyone interested in Highguard finally got to see what the fuss was all about. The early signs were good, as the official Highguard website crashed after the game‚Äôs launch. People flocked to the F2P shooter like birds to bread, but opinions formulated very quickly.

‚ÄúMostly Negative‚Äù reviews bombarded Steam, and complaints about the shooter were quite common:

  • The maps were too big.
  • The loot phase of the match was boring.
  • Action was fairly limited outside of the Raid phase.
  • Wardens were fairly generic.
  • PC performance issues.
  • The price of microtransactions.
  • Highguard‚Äôs identity was lacking by being too many games wrapped into one perfect package.

Post-Launch

A steep and instant player drop-off prompted the developer to target the game‚Äôs biggest gripes. Credit to Wildlight, they addressed the nature of big maps and small teams with the permanent addition of a 5v5 Raid Mode.

With Episode 1 underway and a full Highguard 2026 Roadmap, the team must have thought the game had a chance. Barely two weeks later, the game‚Äôs all-time Steam peak of 97,249 turned into a 3,580 24-hour peak by mid-February.

Highguard & Wildlight Entertainment Layoffs, Explained

On February 11, it was reported and confirmed that Wildlight Entertainment had to ‚Äúpart ways with a number of our team members‚Äù as part of mass layoffs caused by Highguard‚Äôs unsuccessful start.

Insider Gaming wishes nothing but the best for any developers laid off from Wildlight Entertainment. It‚Äôs not clear how many people have succumbed to Highguard‚Äôs mass layoffs, but Alex Graner, a senior-level designer at Wildlight, said in a LinkedIn post that it was he and ‚Äúmost of the team at Wildlight.‚Äù

An official Wildlight statement has since said it is: ‚ÄúKeeping a core group of developers to continue innovating on and supporting the game.‚Äù So, if you are enjoying Highguard, its development looks to be continuing for now.

Like Concord, XDefiant, the relaunched MultiVersus, and so many other live-service games before it, you have to wonder how long Highguard has left. If the player exodus continues, its future could be bleak.

How many hours have you put into Highguard? What do you enjoy or dislike? What could Wildlight have done differently with the game‚Äôs release? Share all your opinions and more via the Insider Gaming Discord Server.

item.title: You Can Get GTA 6 For Free, But You Need To Tick a HUGE Box First
item.content:encoded:
Everyone is in eager anticipation of the impending release of Grand Theft Auto 6. It will arguably be the biggest single-game release in history, shifting millions of copies in the first few hours alone, and it‚Äôs set to break the internet, render countless gamers incapable of working, and dominate social and streaming feeds for weeks to come.

In case you had concerns about buying Grand Theft Auto 6 later this year, there is a method you can use to get GTA 6 for free, but it involves one hell of a requirement.

You need to have a baby on November 19, 2026.

It‚Äôs Not a Joke, Says Norwegian Firm

In Norway, an electronics firm named Komplett has kick-started a marketing campaign built around rewarding budding parents with a free copy of GTA 6.

If you conceive around now, you‚Äôll likely be celebrating the birth of your child around the release date of Grand Theft Auto 6, which is set (at the moment) for November 19, 2026. If your baby is born on that day, Komplett will help you usher in your bouncing bundle of joy by giving you a free copy of GTA 6, arguably the most anticipated game ever made.

On the ‚ÄòGaming‚Äô subreddit, one user posted an image of an advertisement spotted at a railway station in Norway. It was a shot of rose petals on a ruffled bed, with the caption:

GTA 6 dropping in 9 months üòâ

Then, an Instagram post surfaced from the company, bearing the caption:

this is actually not a joke, GTA 6 will be released in 9 months (ü§û) and if you have a baby on the release date, you‚Äôll get the game for free from us

It‚Äôs a marketing stunt that could pay off in dividends for the firm, as every man and their dog wants to secure a copy of Grand Theft Auto 6, and what better way to do that than to get it for free? Coincidentally, GTA 6 will be released almost nine months to the day after Valentine‚Äôs Day.

What‚Äôs ironic is that you‚Äôll most likely be knee-deep in diapers and formula, and will have much bigger concerns than scoping out the jiggle physics or the deepest secrets of Leonida in Grand Theft Auto 6.

Are you going to try to arrange an entry to this giveaway? Let us know (or maybe don‚Äôt) on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

item.title: Team Vitality Signs Veteran Warzone Squad for Esports World Cup
item.content:encoded:
Team Vitality has stepped up ahead of the Esports World Cup and secured a crack squad in the Call of Duty: Warzone space. It‚Äôs yet another roster the organization is fielding, all with the intention of having the best chances possible of snatching the lion‚Äôs share of the Club Championship prize.

The trio signed by Team Vitality features Sage, blazt, and skullface, all of whom have secured accolades aplenty in the Call of Duty: Warzone space and are ready for their next challenge under the Vitality banner.

Vitality Picks Up Killer Warzone Team for EWC

Leading the Team Vitality squad into the fray at the Esports World Cup this summer will be Ethan ‚ÄòEbatez‚Äô Bates, a former 100 Thieves coach with skin in the game. The championship-grade roster should have no issues competing on the grandest stage in esports in Riyadh this summer.

Sage was previously signed with Virtus and finished in third place at last year‚Äôs Esports World Cup. He also had a close finish at the 2024 Global Finals of the World Series of Warzone, but won the 2023 Global Finals, alongside Shifty and Biffle.

Blazt, one of the most recognizable names in Call of Duty, has been around the houses over the last decade. His path has taken him under the banners of compLexity, G2 Esports, the Los Angeles Guerrillas, 100 Thieves, and now, Team Vitality. He‚Äôll be looking to redeem a fourth-place finish at last year‚Äôs Esports World Cup.

Skullface is arguably entering the pack with something major to prove. It has been a while since his last big win, but he came second at the 2024 World Series of Warzone after clutching up and securing the top spot in 2022‚Äôs tournament.

On paper, it‚Äôs a pretty good squad, and every player there has years of Warzone experience to pull from.

Do you think it‚Äôs enough for Team Vitality to land a big win at the Esports World Cup this summer? Let us know your thoughts on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

item.title: Gothic 1 Remake Release Date Revealed With New Trailer
item.content:encoded:
The Gothic 1 Remake by Alkimia Interactive and THQ Nordic will release on June 5, 2026, for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X/S, and PC.

Remakes have gained significant popularity in the gaming industry recently. Developers have successfully tapped into nostalgia while updating older titles to suit modern consoles better. The latest announcement is for a remake of a game that was originally released nearly 25 years ago.

Gothic Remake Releases in June 2026

THQ Nordic has unveiled a new trailer for the Gothic 1 Remake, confirming its June release date. The trailer showcases a variety of cinematics and gameplay, providing insights into the game‚Äôs narrative and premise. It also highlights the different combat moves players can execute and the types of enemies they will encounter. Interested viewers can watch the new trailer below:

About Gothic 1 Remake

In an effort to find magic ore to strengthen their defenses, the king of the Kingdom of Myrtana ordered prisoners to work in the Khorinis mines. To ensure that no one could escape, he erected a magical barrier around the mines. However, something went wrong, trapping everyone inside and turning the mines into a lawless land.

The Gothic 1 Remake is an open-world RPG set in a distinct colony. The developers have rebuilt the game from the ground up while maintaining the original experience‚Äôs unique sense of unrestricted exploration and rewarding progression. The remake enhances the original by introducing more detailed questlines, improved NPC routines and interactions, new traversal abilities, and a fully modernized combat system.

Talking about remakes, a figurine of Edward Kenway from Assassin‚Äôs Creed Black Flag Remake had recently surfaced online. Additionally, Final Fantasy 7 Part 3 Remake will stick to Unreal Engine 4. item.title: ARC Raiders Brings in Close to 6 Million Players Every Week
item.content:encoded:
A new earnings release reveals that ARC Raiders has sold 14 million units and has brought in close to 6 million weekly active users.

We all know ARC Raiders had a sensational launch, becoming one of the most popular extraction shooters of 2025. The title hit 12 million copies sold last month, and players were rewarded with a free gift to celebrate the occasion. Now, they have revealed even more stats in the latest earnings release.

ARC Raiders Sales Hit 14 Million Copies; 6 Million Weekly Active Users Revealed

Nexon‚Äôs latest earnings report reveals the most recent sales figures and weekly active user statistics for ARC Raiders. The game has consistently ranked among the top sellers on Steam, PlayStation, and Xbox. In January, it reached a peak of 960,000 concurrent players and has maintained approximately six million weekly active users since then. This strong sales performance and player engagement are expected to continue, thanks to monthly content updates and live events.

ARC Raiders just released a brand-new update that dropped loads of new content. Players have a new Shared Watch event where they have to team up with others and battle against enemies. The popular Cold Snap condition is back in rotation, and there are also new cosmetic sets that players can check out, along with content and bug fixes. Interested readers can check out the full patch notes for update 1.15.0 here.

In other news, check out why ARC Raiders might be too far gone for a PvE event to function properly. Additionally, the developers have released hotfixes for the Ammo and Duplication glitches.
